title: How to Play a Bm Chord on Guitar

steps.title: Place your first finger.
steps.content: Place your first finger. To start this simple version of the Bm chord, put your pointer finger on the first E string at the second fret. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Place your second finger.
steps.content: Place your second finger. Next, put your middle finger on the second B string at the third fret. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Place your third finger.
steps.content: Place your third finger. Finally, put your ring finger on the third G string at the fourth fret. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Leave the fourth D string open.
steps.content: Leave the fourth D string open. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Strum the chord.
steps.content: Strum the chord. Starting from the open D string, drag your pick or thumb across the D, G, B, and E strings to play the Bm chord. Do not include the sixth E nor the fifth A string. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Barre your first finger.
steps.content: Barre your first finger. A “barre” is when you use the same fingering across more than one string. [7] X Research source In this intermediate version of the chord, start by placing your first finger on the fifth A string at the second fret. Press it down it flat across to the first E string. All five strings should now be pressed down at the second fret.

steps.title: Place your second finger.
steps.content: Place your second finger. Just as the previous method, put your second finger on the second B string at the third fret. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Place your third finger.
steps.content: Place your third finger. This is different from the previous method in that you put your third finger on the fourth D string at the fourth fret. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Place your fourth finger.
steps.content: Place your fourth finger. You’re actually going to put your fourth pinky finger on the third G string at the fourth fret, right next to your third finger. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Strum the chord.
steps.content: Strum the chord. For this intermediate version, you’re not going to play the sixth E string. Instead, start your pick or thumb on the fifth string and strum through to the first to play the chord. Do not include the sixth E string. [11] X Research source

steps.title: Barre your first finger.
steps.content: Barre your first finger. This time, extend your first finger across all six strings. [12] X Research source Start by placing your first finger on the sixth E string at the second fret. Press it down it flat across all the strings to the first E string. All six strings should now be pressed down at the second fret.

steps.title: Place your second finger.
steps.content: Place your second finger. Just as the previous methods, put your second finger on the second B string at the third fret. [13] X Research source

steps.title: Place your third finger.
steps.content: Place your third finger. Similar to intermediate method, put your third finger on the fourth D string at the fourth fret. [14] X Research source

steps.title: Place your fourth finger.
steps.content: Place your fourth finger. Finally, put your fourth finger on the third G string at the fourth fret, right next to your third finger. [15] X Research source

steps.title: Strum the chord.
steps.content: Strum the chord. For this full version, you’re going to play all six strings, so go ahead and strum all the way through. [16] X Research source
